title: Is Taliyah supposed to be the 'classic' mage we were promised for 2016?
body: If so i must say that im kind of disappointed. Shes not really a 'classic' mage at all but another roaming mage like Aurelion Sol.

She is. We feel roaming is a pretty standard mage thing, given mages generally have access to both strong push and hard CC, both of which are really useful if you're playing in a position where roaming's appropriate (mid lane in particular).

What defines a "classic" mage? Roaming aside, she seems to interact much more strongly with terrain and zone/positioning than most mages. In that way, I think she's the most successful champion design in a long time, on all fronts (gameplay, theme, lore), but I wouldn't really call her "classic" in the way that say, Annie or Brand are "classic" designs.

The framing of a "classic mage" was brought up in a conversation that mentioned that the only mage released in a time had been Azir, who builds AP, but is played primarly via basic attacks (although outsourced ones).

In this specific case, a "classic mage" refers to a champion that builds primarily AP, deals mostly magic damage and interacts with the game mainly through their abilities, rather than autoattacks (Azir) or their passive (Aurelion Sol).
Pretty broad definition, but I'll take it, lol. Thanks!
